title: Use interval to conclude test for population mean

content.question: A two-sided t-test for a population mean is conducted of the null hypothesis H0 : Î¼ = 100. If a 90 percent t-interval constructed from the same sample data contains the value of 100, which of the following can be concluded about the test at a significance level of a = 0.10 ?

choices.label: The p-value is less than 0.10, and H0 should be rejected.
The p-value is less than 0.10, and H0 should not be rejected.
The p-value is greater than 0.10, and H0 should be rejected.
The p-value is greater than 0.10, and H0 should not be rejected.
There is not enough information given to make a conclusion about the p-value and H0.

content.answer: The p-value is greater than 0.10, and H0 should not be rejected.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
